revisionDesc.change: CREATED: This bibl record was autogenerated from a Zotero record.

analytic.title: Glanes apocryphales chrétiennes dans des textes arméniens et géorgiens

monogr.title: Philologie, herméneutique et histoire des textes entre Orient et Occident. Mélanges en hommage à Sever J. Voicu

biblStruct.note: In some Armenian and Georgian liturgical and patristic works (either translations or original texts), references to Greek or Syriac Apocrypha may sometimes be found. The existence of such references in Armenian and Georgian languages shows the diffusion of some apocrypha outside of the Syriac, Greek and Latin worlds. It also testifies to the interest that the two Caucasian Churches very early showed in those texts. The use of non-canonical texts in the hymns sung during liturgical celebrations also points to the freedom of the Churches and their wish to extend the Gospel accounts, especially in Jerusalem, where many of those texts originate. The present article provides a first list of those references, but has no pretension to be comprehensive.

body.bibl: Renoux, Charles. “Glanes Apocryphales Chrétiennes Dans Des Textes Arméniens et Géorgiens.” In Philologie, Herméneutique et Histoire Des Textes Entre Orient et Occident. Mélanges En Hommage à Sever J. Voicu, edited by Francesca P. Barone, Caroline Macé, and Pablo Ubierna, 671–84. Instrumenta Patristica et Mediaevalia 73. Turnhout: Brepols, 2017.

Charles Renoux, Glanes Apocryphales Chrétiennes Dans Des Textes Arméniens et Géorgiens, in Philologie, Herméneutique et Histoire Des Textes Entre Orient et Occident. Mélanges En Hommage à Sever J. Voicu, ed. Francesca P. Barone, Caroline Macé, and Pablo Ubierna, Instrumenta Patristica et Mediaevalia 73 (Turnhout: Brepols, 2017), 671–84.
